result.execSummary:
The defendant Willie Cooks Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Willie Cooks Jr is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Willie Cooks Jr was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Willie Cooks Jr was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Court waives all costs, fees, assessments and surcharges (including DNA and DV), due to the defendant's inability to pay

AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.   
Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY (except for prescribed medication);   Random screens.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Willie Cooks Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Willie Cooks in court PRO SE.  Porchia Sharese Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.
Request for payment of $17  witness fees for witness Euvelyn S.  processed and forwarded to the Treasurer's Office on check request x26212610 in court 1x on 8/10/15.
Witness fee request prepared for Euvelyn S. will be forwarded to DAs Victim/Witness Services for approval and date confirmation.
Probation Review Hearing scheduled for 01-22-2016 at 01:30 pm.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by Evelyn S., the State, defense counsel and defendant as to sentencing.

As to Count 2:
COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE -  2 years with  135 days credit, consecutive to any other sentence -  INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT -  1 year  -  EXTENDED SUPERVISION -  1 year

As to Count 3:
COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE -  2 years with  Zero days credit, consecutive to the sentence imposed as to Count 2; -  INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT -  1 year  -  EXTENDED SUPERVISION -  1 year

Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is NOT eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

As to both counts:
Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on probation for 2 YEARS with the following conditions:
- Serve 3 MONTHS condition time in the House of Correction, STRAIGHT time
Further:
- Court ordered 90 days in the House of Correction; stayed for the use at the discretion of the probation department. (45 days each count)
- Attend and successfully complete an Anger Mgmnt program
- Mental Health evaluation and comply with any recommended treatment
- Take all prescribed medication
- Comply with any treatment or programming ordered by probation
- AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.
- Absolute Sobriety (except for prescribed medication)
- Random Screens
- No drugs without a valid prescription
- No contact with the victim without the approval of the probation agent
- Obtain GED/HSD
- Defendant is NOT ordered to provide DNA sample
- Court waives all costs, fees, assessments and surcharges (including DNA surcharge) due to defendant's inability to pay (DV assessment struck at plea hearing)
- No contact with firearms
- Attend the probation review hearing on 01-22-2016

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- Attend and successfully complete an Anger Mgmnt program
- Mental Health evaluation and comply with any recommended treatment
- Take all prescribed medication
- Comply with any treatment or programming ordered by probation
- AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.
- Absolute Sobriety (except for prescribed medication)
- Random Screens
- No drugs without a valid prescription
- No contact with the victim
 without the approval of the probation agent
- Obtain GED/HSD
- Defendant is NOT ordered to provide DNA sample
- Court waives all costs, fees, assessments and surcharges (including DNA surcharge) due to defendant's inability to pay (DV assessment struck at plea hearing)
- No contact with firearms

Appeal rights given.  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence, Pretrial Incarceration Credit and Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.  Copies given to the defendant.

Defendant Willie Cooks in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Defendant Willie Cooks in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

As to Count 2 and Count 3:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty and enters judgment of conviction into the record forthwith. 

Court orders Domestic Abuse Assessment enhancement stricken as to both counts.

As to Count 1:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on State's motion, Court orders Count 1 DISMISSED.

Parties are prepared to proceed to sentencing.

Certification of transcript of proceedings of PRELIMINARY HEARING commencing 05/08/2015 received and filed. (13 Pages)
Copy of transcript forwarded to Atty. Louis Epps, 819 North 6th Street, Milwaukee, WI, 53203.

Defendant Willie Cooks in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Defendant Willie Cooks in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  Milwaukee Police Department Detective Mark Peterson.  Exhibit #1 marked, offered and received into evidence.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.   State's exhibit #1 withdrawn.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Willie Cooks in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Defendant Willie Cooks in custody.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Br. 4 for Br. 40.
Doctor's report received and filed.  All parties reviewed the report.  No challenges made to the report.  Court finds that the defendant is competent to proceed in this case.  Court reinstates the proceedings.  Case adjourned for Preliminary Hearing in Branch 40 on 5-8-2015 at 1:30 pm.   mld
Due to Court calendar congestion case spun to Judge Flanagan in Branch 4.
received and filed.  rmm

Defendant Willie Cooks in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Defendant Willie Cooks in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Case set for preliminary hearing.  Defense counsel informs the court that he believes that the defendant is not competent to proceed. Pursuant to Sec. 971.14(2) Wis. Stats., Court ordered defendant to be examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit.  Order for Competency Examination, signed and filed. Copy forwarded to the Forensic Unit. Court ordered case adjourned for doctor report return in Branch 40.  Court ordered the time limits for the preliminary hearing tolled.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for May 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription or no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Willie Cooks in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  
Defendant Willie Cooks in custody.  
Karen A. Loebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40. 
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing. 
Defendant pleads Not Guilty as to all Misdemeanor Counts.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
